channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Companies Might Soon Have to Tell You When Their Products Will Die
item.description: If everything’s computer, it would be nice to know how long computer last.

item.title: TechCrunch All Stage unveils a powerhouse agenda for founders
item.description: TechCrunch All Stage (formerly Early Stage) returns to Boston on July 15, and the agenda for our tentpole East Coast founder event is almost complete....

item.title: The United States of Elon Musk Inc.
item.description: The degree to which Donald Trump and Elon Musk’s interests are intertwined is unprecedented—and ultimately unsustainable.

item.title: How to Back Up Your iPhone to iCloud, MacOS, or Windows (2025)
item.description: Save your memories before you grab a new iPhone or update to the latest version of iOS.

item.title: How to Set Up Your New iPhone (2025)
item.description: Welcome to your new Apple smartphone. Here’s how to get the most out of it right out of the box.

item.title: Xbox debuts a new AI-powered gaming companion for mobile users

item.title: Researchers Propose a Better Way to Report Dangerous AI Flaws
item.description: After identifying major flaws in popular AI models, researchers are pushing for a new system to identify and report bugs.

item.title: Apple’s appeal against UK’s secret iCloud backdoor order must be held in public, rights groups urge

item.title: OpenAI’s ‘creative writing’ AI evokes that annoying kid from high school fiction club
